comments.body:
This was previously crashing, because `obj` was `ndarray`, and did not have the metadata property.

I think there's a bigger issue here in that `__array_prepare__` is not called either, but with `__array_ufunc__` approaching release, I don't think we need to fix that any more

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +54,58 @@            def __array_wrap__(self, obj, context=None):
                if isinstance(obj, MyArray):
                    obj.metadata = self.metadata
                return obj

comments.body: Can you describe in the commit message why these changes were needed?

Done. This was indeed a non-trivial one - I had to look again to remind me why it was needed.  I wondered about the use of stating it in the commit message until I recalled that with `git blame` one can find why this was added.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +57,61 @@
            def __array_finalize__(self, obj):
                self.metadata = getattr(obj, 'metadata', None)
                return self
